articles.title: Hummingbird that was feared extinct is spotted in Colombian mountains
articles.description: The Santa Marta sabrewing, an emerald green hummingbird, has been officially documented for only the second time since it was discovered in 1946

articles.title: Early humans may have wiped out many turtles millions of years ago
articles.description: Our hominin ancestors wiped out many land-living turtle and tortoise species starting around 5 million years ago, an analysis of the fossil record suggests
articles.content:
By Michael Le Page
Tortoises would have been easy prey for early humans

articles.title: Transfusing blood from an old mouse to a younger mouse causes ageing
articles.description: The transfusion led an increased number of senescent cells – which accumulate as we get older - in the young mice, suggesting that cellular ageing isn't just a case of wear and tear
articles.content:
By Chris Stokel-Walker
Transfusing the blood of an old mouse into a younger rodent may age the latter animal

articles.title: How weevils have become weapons in UK's fight against invasive plants
articles.description: A weevil designed to kill a problem aquatic weed is the fourth of a new wave of biological agents selected by the Centre for Agriculture and Bioscience International to tackle the economic and biodiversity scourge of invasive species
articles.content:
By Adam Vaughan
Listronotus elongatus, a South American weevil
CABI

articles.title: Quantum computers would be better at Wordle than classical ones
articles.description: A player using a quantum algorithm will win the codebreaking game Mastermind, which has the same underlying principles as Wordle, more often and in fewer moves than someone using a classical algorithm
articles.content:
By Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
Is your Wordle strategy quantum?
Tada Images/Shutterstock

articles.title: Can we build a quantum clock that is entirely quantum?
articles.description: Quantum clocks are normally controlled by a classical control system, but to build things like tiny quantum drones that fly around delivering molecules we'll need a fully quantum approach

articles.title: Vaccinating less than half of high-risk men may stop monkeypox spread

articles.title: European wildfires have released a record amount of carbon
articles.description: The climate-warming pollution from wildfires in the first half of 2022 in the EU and UK has been on a par with the annual emissions of Cyprus
